msContents.summary: Ends of Iliad i.215-220 and beginnings of 250-266. At the end of column I, line 217 extends so far into the intercolumnar space that it is clear that this is an amateur copy or school exercise. In the second column the papyrus is warped so that the second half of the lines is raised. All apostrophes are marked, as are dieresis and paragraphi.

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers. There are two kollemata. The back is blank.

Written in a combination of a mixed and round style. Barlett (BASP 48) accounts for the discrepancies but essential similarity between cols. 1 and 2 (the latter is less bilinear, shows less consistency in spacing and letter height, etc.) by suggesting that col. 1 was written by a teacher and col. 2 by a student.

provenance.p: Given to Columbia University by the Egypt Exploration Society, 1907

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

listBibl.bibl: P.Oxy. III 537 Descriptum; C. F. Barlett, BASP 48 (2011): 11-14. MP(3) 589; LDAB 1998; Allen 122; West 122.
